comments:
We have workspaces with about 20 projects, with several dependencies. A few of
these projects have about 20 user libraries, and some of those are exported.
Other projects have fewer libraries.

Our big issue is that the user libraries frequently stop working when we close
and reopen Eclipse. This causes errors in the workspace. When this happens, in
the project that has the errors we can no longer navigate the user libraries
(can't open the jars, the + sign is gone from the icon). This happens in
different machines with the same projects.

I'm attaching the bitmaps so you can tell the difference
Created an attachment (id=27316)
normal behaviour

this is the regular eclipse behaviour
Created an attachment (id=27317)
broken behaviour

this is the behaviour when the bug manifests itself
forgot to say that the only sure way to get rid of this (temporarily) is to
close and reopen the project, and rebuild

we don't use any plugins (we recreated our workspace from scratch without any)
Anything in .metadata/.log file when this problem occurs?
Are you using official 3.1 build (ie. I20050627-1435)?
Which VM do you use to launch eclipse?
I'm using 1.4.2_08 from sun.
I was using the official 3.1 build, but upgraded to M20050914-1235 in hopes of
solving this problem.

Unfortunately these info is not enough to really understand your problem.
Would it be possible to make a VM snapshot when it occurs?

To get it, start eclipse using -consoleLog argument, then you'll get a DOS
Windows opened for console. Resize Screen Buffer Size of this windows
(Propserties in top-left popup-menu): width=256, height=9999 and set Quick Edit
Mode.

When problem occurs, hit Ctrl+Pause in this window, then you'll get a list
displayed in it with all VM informations sarting with:
Full thread dump Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (1.4.2_04-b05 mixed mode):
....
Select all text and copy it in comment of this bug, thanks

Another thought about this problem: does it occur only in same workspace or did
you reproduce it in another one? If you only have one workspace, perhaps would
it be possible to try in a brand new one? I wonder if your current workspace may
have some corrupted data...
This has been reproduced in 4 workspaces so far.

I will do as you ask
Here it is, hope it helps

Thanks for the info, but again, this does not help a lot... :-(
Would it be possible to reproduce in a small workspace and send it to me
(frederic_fusier@fr.ibm.com)?
I don't think I can reproduce it in a small workspace. Other colleagues that
have simpler workspace don't encounter the bug.

I can send you my workspace, I just can't send you the code. Would that be enough ?
Send me your workspace but I need at least projects and user libraries in it to
have a chance to reproduce it.

Perhaps one of your colleague may try to use your workspace on his or her box
and see if this problem also happens on another eclipse install... I wonder now
if this can be your eclipse install which may be corrupted. Another way to
verify this is to make a brand new install of eclipse (not an update) on your
box and see if you're still able to reproduce it on your wokrspace...
I don't think it's my workspace, since we already started fresh with new
workspaces (two times) and new eclipse installs, and it keeps coming back.

When you say projects you mean code ? I can send you the entire workspace dir
(about 20Mb), but wouldn't be able to send you actual java code.

Entire workspace dir without code should be OK to try to reproduce...
You sent me only .metadata directory. I also needed to have project
configurations (ie. .project and .classpath files).

However, it seems there's some interesting things in your .log file...
There's many exception you didn't tell me about. For example:
java.lang.IllegalStateException
	at
org.eclipse.jface.text.projection.ProjectionMapping.toImageLine(ProjectionMapping.java:478)
	at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer.modelLine2WidgetLine(TextViewer.java:4745)

So, for the while, forget about sending your workspace to me. Just clean your
.log file (ie. delete or rename it) and restart your workspace. When problem
occurs again, please attach your .log file to this bug.

Second point, export *all* your workspace preferences in a file and also attach
it to this bug (this would help me to figure out what is your classpathes and
user libraries configuration).

Thanks
Created an attachment (id=27508)
Eclipse preferences

Is this the file you need ?
Yes, that's it for preferences, thanks
I also need .log file just after problem occurs (do not forget to delete this
file before starting eclipse...)
Hi,

nothing appears in the log file, except the following. Still, every morning the
problem occurs, and I have to close all my projects, and reopen them. for some
projects this doesn't work, and I have to frequently rebuild them

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 2 2005-09-28 18:40:06.500
!MESSAGE Job found still running after platform shutdown.  Jobs should be
canceled by the plugin that scheduled them during shutdown:
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.ui.TestRunnerViewPart$JUnitIsRunningJob
I also cannot reproduce your problem using your preferences in a fresh new
workspace (comment 11).
Problem seems to come from your workspace. So, we have to track down this issue
on your box...

Please create an .options file in eclipse launch directory (ie. <directory where
you installed eclipse>/eclipse) containing following lines:

# Turn on debug tracing for org.eclipse.jdt.core plugin
org.eclipse.jdt.core/debug=true

# Reports Java model elements opening/closing
org.eclipse.jdt.core/debug/javamodel=true

Then, start eclipse with -consoleLog argument in command line and when problem
occurs, copy console outputs in a file and attach this file to this bug, thanks

Hope we'll get some interesting info which can help us to understand what happen
here...
Please reopen when providing requested info
Reopen to set as duplicate...


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 152926 ***
